name: Confortel Bel Art

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights to celebrate my 30th birthday. Having booked the 'Romantic room' through LastMinute.com for about £100 extra, we expected something a little bit special. Unfortunately we were both very disappointed. Apart from the promised bottle of Cava and few chocolates, the room had nothing romantic about it. I probably haven't stayed in less romantic one! The standard of the room was by no means four star! The room had an outdated decor, the bed was extremely uncomfortable (would probably compare it to the cheapest Ikea guest bed), the bathroom was in poor state of disrepair. We had to be moved to different room after the showerhead broke on our second day.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception and lobby areas are immaculate and impressive but don't get fooled by these like we did. The rooms are a different story! Don't stay in this hotel if you expect four star standard of accomodation and friendly, helpful staff.
reviews.title: Cheap & Cheerful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, on a cheap city break. The location is not completely central but if you don't mind doing a little walking or taking the metro then its ideal for a short break away. Only a 6/7 min walk to the nearest Metro station, and about 10 min walk to Sagrada Familia which also has some lovely Tapas restaurants along a pedestrian walkway. The hotel itself is clean and perfectly functional if you don't plan on doing much lounging around. The rooms are small but modern and have all the necessary facilities. The lobby is large, bright and welcoming with free internet access. We arrived very late (nearly midnight) and were checked in straight away by a very courteous male clerk who had everything ready for us.
reviews.title: Dont Stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately we never woke up in time for breakfast so can't comment on this!
reviews.title: Beautiful & very modern hotel with lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Overall I would recommend this hotel as a good base if you want to do plenty of sightseeing or partying! Plenty of taxis passing by at night for heading out!
reviews.title: Not as bad as some people say...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 day break at the Bel Art Hotel, and thought an update would be good for this Web Site.
reviews.title: Not an ideal Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hotel is OK, would agree that it is not a real 4 Star, as we saw other 4 Star Hotels in Barcelona that were far better equipped than the Bel Art. The previous write ups regarding being next door to a nightclub worried me (the booking was a surprise weekend away with my family). Good news it is now closed and being bulldozed!! I would not liked to have stayed there when it was open, as it would have been a nightmare.
reviews.title: Not a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the hotel is fine (again, nowhere near 4 Star), the staff OK (nowhere near 4 Star) and the bedrooms OK (yes, you've guessed the next word).
reviews.title: Would not Recommend
We enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: The location is the hotels biggest downside. I read in the website that the hotel is 300m's from the Sagrada Famillila....Rubbish. it must be about 1.2 miles away on foot through some quiet residential locations that were not comfortable walking through. We tried the Metro the first night, got the diections from the hotel, and went by every word, and got off the Metro even further away from where we wanted to get to!! With a wife, and 2 children, I was not that impressed. You would have thought a "4 Star" hotel, or any hotel that would have guests looking to get to the nearest tourist location, would have done their homework and got their directions correct!! To sum up, we taxi'd in and out of the city centre (approx 8-12 euros depending on taxi driver!) at all times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If however, you wanted to go to Barcelona, be in amongst the hype, noise and fun, but be able to taxi back to a quiter location then this could be the place for you, but I would suggest you look to other locations first.
reviews.title: Rather mediocre - definitely not a 4* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked on 1800hotels.ie. Very pleased.Lovely quiet location, strolling distance of Ave.Gaudi with al fresco cafes with SagradaFamilia at end of Av.Gaudi.On yellow line metro alfons X but bus 92 going to the Port (and 14) outside the door and other buses within a stone's throw of the door.We used bus 92 to get us to the shuttlebus for cruise port (at Mirador Colon) - easy peasey. Staff lovely, friendly, helpful and know the city. Bedroom functional, adequate, clean, fab air-con (quiet) but the skimpiest curtains I've ever seen.I also got a wonky bed, one of a twinbeds.My husband's bed was grand. Good maintenance.Breakfast excellent.I've no hesitation is saying its a great value for money hotel in a tranquil area.
reviews.title: Great Belart value&location

likes.liked: — Location, quietness, breakfast, staff, transport ease
likes.disliked: — poor curtains, shaby & not covering the window

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed in the Confortel Bel Art on the 13&14 May 2008 before boarding a four day cruise on the med. We also stayed on the 19 May 2008 prior to our return flight to belfast.
reviews.title: Comfort at the Confortel.....

likes.liked: — Clean room, the breakfast and free minir bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: First things first the hotel is near the Sagria Familia so is not in the centre of Barcelona or the Ramblas. But it is only 200m from the Alfons X metro station and a simple five stop journey takes you to the centre. The hotel is exceptionaly clean, breakfast is beautiful and best of all the mini bar is free. We checked in on the 19th at 9.30am and the hotel was more than happy to accomodate us with a room.
reviews.title: Sewer smell and misleading list of free amenities

likes.disliked: — Front desk staff weren't so friendly, room smelled like sewer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good hotel and location

likes.disliked: — air con was blowing hot not cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel wasn't all bad, but there were several things that made our stay less than perfect.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but out of the way
Bel Smell
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Bel Art in August 2006 for 4 nights having booked 2 rooms for our family of 4. On arrival we were given rooms on the second floor. They stlll had ashtrays in them despite our request for non smoking and smelt strongly of deoderiser - we complained and were moved to ground floor rooms which were basic but clean, but still smelt of deoderiser. I suspect they allow guests to smoke in all the rooms. The staff were pleasant enough but the cleaning staff are determined to use strong cleaning products. One evening we heard them scrubbing the hall carpets outside our rooms with amonia - we had to go out to escape the fumes. They also like things strong in the hotel bar. We requested 2 white coffees which we couldn't drink - they were so strong!

likes.disliked: — The cleaning fumes that pervade the hallways and rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I feel this hotel would equate to a 2 or 3 star rating in the UK. All the rooms at the back face a buildings about 10 feet away which are also on a small alleyway down which motorcycles speed long into the night. We have stayed in Barcelona before without any problems so were really diappointed with this hotel.
reviews.title: i would stay here again...

likes.liked: — cleanliness and helpfulness of the staff

reviews.title: Very good choice
reviews.text: I am a travel agent and we use this hotel quite a bit, so i decided to go and see what it was like for myself and I wasnt disapointed. The hotel itself is excellent. The rooms are a good size as are the bathrooms. The only problem we had was that you dont have tea and coffee facilities in your room and the bar in reception is only open from 6pm to 11pm.

reviews.title: Quality Hotel Bel Art is a Nice Hotel and a Great Location
reviews.text: The breakfasts in the morning as lovely, they offer anything from fruit and cereal to cook breakfast all in buffett style. the breakfast is availble from around 8am to 11am.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a bit far out from the main area of barcelona, but there are several restaurants within a ten minute walk to the diagonal area.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing particularly wrong with this hotel. It is in a good location for both the Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell, is clean and is good value for Barcelona. Rooms are of a decent size and bathrooms are large and fully functional, and in the area around the hotel there are many restaurants and bars serving tapas and more substantial meals for a lot less than what you would be likely to pay around Las Ramblas.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a reasonable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand however, the majority of rooms appear to be designated as smoking, which obviously results in non-smokers experiencing a rather unpleasant smell. Additionally, a curtain in our room came complete with a hole which looked as though a previous occupier had either inadvertently left it draped over the nearby lamp or burnt it with a cigarette - regardless of which, it badly needed to be replaced. Finally, although the location is fine, to visit Las Ramblas and the waterfront there really is no option other than to make use of public transport unless you wish to spent several hours each day on your feet: the metro is excellent but changing lines can result in a trek of more than half a mile through underground corridors.
reviews.title: Lobby is all show...but not reflected in rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a good value hotel in a reasonable location but one that does not really live up to its four-star rating.
reviews.title: Great value for reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights over the Easter weekend. Rooms are basic but clean. Walls are paper thin, so if you do stay here make sure you have earplugs!!! Bathroom was dated and there was mold growing in the corners of the shower/bath. April is considered "Winter" so aircon only blew hot air....luckily we could open the window.
reviews.title: Ideal hotel for our purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel would be ok value for approx €55 per night. Unfortunately we booked this as part of the LastMinute.com - Top Secret Hotels and paid approx €90 per night. We have stayed in much nicer hostels!!!
reviews.title: good valoue-location just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fairly cheap hotel, which are generally difficult to find in Barcelona - and much better than the various hostels on offer.
reviews.title: Rooms let it down a bit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is not that great - it is quite a long way out of the centre and up a big hill! However the neighbourhood feels safe and does have some good attractions close by - the Sagrada Familia and the old hospital. There are some places to eat and drink close by but you are better off catching the metro back into the centre (metro station fairly close to the hotel).
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The communal parts of the hotel are excellent - very swanky with huge stunning light fittings - the restaurant is good and provided a great buffet breakfast (not cooked) - however the rooms let the hotel down slightly as they are a bit dated.
reviews.title: Poor and disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Barcelona in August and stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Location was good. Just 10 mins walk to Sagrada Familiya. Rooms were clean, bathroom was also clean. Breakfast was also very good.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Only problem was wireless internet was not working and one out of three PC in the lounge for internet was not working. For other PCs internet speed was very bad.
reviews.title: Do not stay at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 days. The hotel and room was kept clean, was spacious and has a modernistic feel about it. It was cleaned daily and had free water in the mini bar. There are three internet computers on the groiund floor which are free for hotel guests.
reviews.title: Rooms too noisy laminate floor not carpet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms do not have carpet which might have helped to dampen noise and so the main problem we faced was the noise generated by other hotel guests in the early hours of the night i.e people next door and upstairs walking about in high heel shoes on floor boarding. Had there been carpet I'm sure this noise would not have been generated.
reviews.title: Nice room, but only B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed room only so cannot comment on the food. There is no bar and so we had to go to a smokey bar next door for a drink. The location of the hotel is away from the main attractions and bars/restaurants but the Metro is 8 mins walk and 20 mins ride to the La Ramla.
reviews.title: Comfortable but lacking some services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We picked this hotel based on its 4 star rating and price so I guess we would have to pay more for a four star closer to the centre.
reviews.title: Confortel Bel Art - Good Value for Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trying to see Barcelona at reasonable prices we found this hotel. It is located in a very nice and quiet area, not far from Sagrada Familia at 5 minutes walking from a subway station.
reviews.title: A good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very nice staff, good and assorted breakfast. Rooms are clean and nice. Bar is closed too quickly and dinner is available until 10pm but arround the corner is Cafe del Teatro, a nice bistro with nice food, charming staff, very friendly and helpful, even if they don't speak English.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - just a little pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel - modern, clean, every amenitie you could think of and the staff is tremendous and proactive. BUT you will pay for the experience. Don't even think of opening the mini-bar. All in all though, very much worth the price
reviews.title: Decent place, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Before we arrived at the Hotel I was a little worried about my choice but everything was good.
reviews.title: A Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: Quiet location with a few bars/cafes nearby. Just down the road from Alfons X metro station from which you can get to the Barri Gothic (Jaume 1) in 10 minutes without changing lines.
reviews.title: Loved the Bel Art

description: Original and striking, the Confortel Bel Art is located in the heart of the modernist triangle formed by the Sagrada Familia, the Guell Park and Sant Pau Hospital. Alfons X metro station is 300 meters from the hotel. The Confortel Bel Art features original furnishings and colors that add a touch of fun to the guests stay. The rooms are decorated in a classical style and feature all the amenities that will make guests feel at home: free Wi-Fi, free bottled water, free safety deposit box, flat-screen TV, satellite TV and air conditioning. Also, the hotel offers free use of several PC’s located in the main lobby with Wi-Fi Internet access. The Confortel Bel Art has a restaurant where guests can enjoy not only a hearty breakfast but a quiet dinner or their favourite drink after a hard day of work, sightseeing or shopping in the city.
